content: Based on data from the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, the largest consumers of apricots are Iran, Turkey, Uzbekistan, and Algeria. These countries have a long history of apricot cultivation and consumption, as apricots are native to the region. The warm and dry climate of these countries is also suitable for apricot production, leading to high yields and availability of the fruit. Additionally, apricots are often used in traditional cuisine and as a medicinal food in these regions, contributing to their high consumption levels.
